intro: Pedicularis rockii, commonly known as the Tibetan lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas and central Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant features showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to red, often with a distinctive spurred shape. Its leaves are often reduced or scale-like, and it typically grows in rocky or alpine environments. Pedicularis rockii is adapted to cold climates and has a short growing season, blooming in late summer or early autumn.
